data.title: What are your must play PSP games?
data.meta_description: A console I’ve barely dabbled with. I want to see what it’s all about. I’m particularly looking for a solid podcast game as well. The only things I’m not...
data.text:
May 26, 2024

#1

A console I've barely dabbled with. I want to see what it's all about. I'm particularly looking for a solid podcast game as well. The only things I'm not interested in are probably puzzle games and extremely story heavy games.

How MGSV is Peacewalker? I've heard it shares some dna. MGSV had some story but it was a perfect podcast game for me.

Helix

Mayor of Clown Town

#3

Good thread

PSP Essentials: Final Results

"In the 1990s, Nintendo had dominated the handheld market since launching its Game Boy in 1989, experiencing close competition only from Sega's Game Gear (1990–2001) and Bandai's WonderSwan (1999–2003) in Japan.[14] In January 1999, Sony had released the briefly successful PocketStation in Japan...

Tons of excellent games there.

Some of my favorites: Half Minute Hero (PC ver available) and its sequel, Crisis Core for the dub versus the Reunion version, Daxter, P3P, Echochrome (puzzle game tho), God of War Chains of Olympus and Ghost of Sparta, honestly too many too count.

#10

Metal GEAR acid 1 and 2 are both great. Inwa initially disappointed they weren't traditional MGS games, but I ended up loving them. I think they'd be solid podcast games.

Peace Walker is balanced around multiplayer and bosses can be annoying alone. It's mission based and otherwise fun. It definitely shares a lot of DNA with MGS V.

Portable Ops is missing QOL stuff from it, but I liked it and it has better bosses at least. Ive only played the PS3 version of PW, so I don't know how different the controls are on PSP.

The GTA Stories games are great, too.

#20

WipEout Pure and WipEout Pulse are both fantastic high-speed racing games, second only to F-Zero GX in the entire genre IMO.

They both have a feature that lets you use MP3s loaded onto your PSP as the in-game soundtrack. (I think. My PSPs were always modded so I might have just used an MP3 player plugin in the background lol.) Not entirely necessary though, as both games have absolutely banging soundtracks.

Also, Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together is a GOAT-tier turn-based strategy game. And a PERFECT podcast game. It's similar to Final Fantasy Tactics, but with larger-scale battles and more character/class customization.

The recently-released Tactics Ogre Reborn is a remastering of that game, with some pretty large mechanical changes. I personally prefer the PSP version, aside from a few particular QOL additions in the remaster (like nixxing chance-based crafting). It's got plenty of story to engage in whenever you feel like it.

Half Minute Hero is one of the best games ever made. Kind of an oddball arcadish rpg and easily the best game on the platform.

Jeanne D'arc

Growlanser : Wayfarer of Time

Wild Arms XF/Megaman X Maverick Hunter/R-Type Tactics/Hexyz Force are not bad. X is really only because of the new Vile mode tho, otherwise it's not much different then the snes one other than graphics. Breath of Fire 3 is marginally better on PSP then PSX, so that too if you've never played it on PSX.

Lot of RPGs in my list tho, which obv have a lot of story so YMMV on how much is "too much" for you

May 26, 2024

#25

Well I was gonna say Lumines but no puzzle I guess. Patapon is pretty neat and leaves a good first impression but gets old rather quick, well worth trying.

Monster Hunter Freedom Unite and Portable 3rd were great at the time but not a whole lot of reason to go back to those nowadays unless you're really curious about 2nd gen MH.

Castlevania Dracula X Chronicles is a 2.5D remake of Rondo of Blood and includes both that and SOTN. If you've already played Rondo and liked it, it's still worth playing because they mix it up a bit. If you haven't played Rondo it's easily my favorite classic/non-metroidvania game in the series.

To be honest I had a ton of PSP games and just used it as a Monster Hunter machine 99% of the time. Rest of that was the above games and Crisis Core, the latter of which has other options these days.

Returning to Phantasy Star Portable 2 Infinity with PPSSPP.

It has been roughly 10 years since I last played Phantasy Star Portable 2... Portable 2 was an absolute blast to play if you had a PSP back then. It was essentially a single player action adventure game and an MMO right in your pocket, play it on the go or at home, and join one of the many...

Oct 26, 2017

12,813

May 26, 2024

#42

Daxter: Probably my favorite game in the Jak and Daxter series. None of the crappy vehicles and open worlds from 2+3, and IMO it has even more fun levels and platforming than 1.

Tomb Raider Anniversary: not an exclusive, and if you have a PC or any other version of the game is probably better, but I thought the game was fantastic when I played it on PSP back in the day. Some big levels and fun puzzles to solve.

X-men Legends 2: perfect portable RPG/Beat 'em up for the system. Marvel Ultimate Alliance is also on PSP, but for some reason I always preferred Legends 2. Maybe I'm just more of an X-men fan (even though there's a decent amount in MUA).
